title: 112_s3531
content: Expansion of credit for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property. Expansion of credit for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property, including an increase in the credit percentage to 50% for hydrogen-related property and removing the dollar limitation for such property. Additionally, the credit is allowable for refueling property for certain motor vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads. The amendment expands the credit for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property, including off-highway vehicles. It increases the credit percentage to 50% for hydrogen-related property and removes the dollar limitation. The amendment expands the credit for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property, including off-highway vehicles. It defines specified off-highway vehicles as motor-propelled vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads, excluding certain exceptions. The amendment extends the credit for hydrogen property through 2016 for off-highway vehicles designed to carry or tow loads, excluding certain exceptions. The credit for hydrogen property is extended through 2016 for off-highway vehicles designed to carry or tow loads, excluding certain exceptions. The amendments apply to property placed in service after the enactment date, with specific dates for different types of property. Increased investment credit for more efficient fuel cells. Increased investment credit for more efficient fuel cells, with a 50% credit for qualified fuel cell property in a combined heat and power system with an energy efficiency of 70% or more, and a 40% credit for systems with an energy efficiency of at least 60% but less than 70%. Increased investment credit for more efficient fuel cells, with a 50% credit for qualified fuel cell property in a combined heat and power system with an energy efficiency of 70% or more, and a 40% credit for systems with an energy efficiency of at least 60% but less than 70%. Amendments are made to the tax code to reflect these changes. Amendments to the tax code increase the maximum credit for qualified fuel cell property placed in service, with a limit on the credit amount based on the capacity of the property. The amendments to the tax code increase the maximum credit for qualified fuel cell property based on its capacity, with specific dollar amounts allocated per 0.5 kilowatt capacity. The effective date for these changes applies to taxable years after the enactment of the Act.
